bforecast(ds, groups, length=1, R=100, level=0.95, kind='recurrent', interval='confidence', only_new=True, only_intervals=False, drop=True, drop_attributes=False, cache=True, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ
data(name)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function for loading available in pyrssa package datasets. Available datasets are stored in the data directory.

Parameters:

name ‚Äì Name of dataset to load

Returns:

iossa(x: SSA, nested_groups, tol=1e-05, kappa=2, maxiter=100, norm=None, trace=False, kappa_balance=0.5, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ
parestimate(x, groups, method='esprit', subspace='column', normalize_roots=None, dimensions=None, solve_method='ls', drop=True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Function to estimate the parameters (frequencies and rates) given a set of SSA eigenvectors.

Parameters:

  • x ‚Äì SSA object

  • groups ‚Äì list of indices of eigenvectors to estimate from

  • method ‚Äì For 1D-SSA, Toeplitz SSA, and MSSA: parameter estimation method, ‚Äòesprit‚Äô for 1D-ESPRIT (Algorithm 3.3 in Golyandina et al ( 2018)), ‚Äòpairs‚Äô for rough estimation based on pair of eigenvectors (Algorithm 3.4 in Golyandina et al (2018)). For nD-SSA: parameter estimation method. For now only ‚Äòesprit‚Äô is supported (Algorithm 5.6 in Golyandina et al ( 2018)). lowest dimension, when possible (length of groups is one)

  • subspace ‚Äì which subspace will be used for parameter estimation

  • normalize_roots ‚Äì logical vector or None, force signal roots to lie on unit circle. None means automatic selection: normalize iff circular topology OR Toeplitz SSA used

  • dimensions ‚Äì a vector of dimension indices to perform ESPRIT along. None means all dimensions.

  • solve_method ‚Äì approximate matrix equation solving method, ‚Äòls‚Äô for least-squares, ‚Äòtls‚Äô for total-least-squares.

  • drop ‚Äì logical, if ‚ÄòTRUE‚Äô then the result is coerced to lowest dimension, when possible (length of groups is one)

Returns:

plot(ts, x=None, kind=None, add_residuals=True, add_original=True, idx=None, scales=None, contrib=True, layout=None, superpose=False, method=None)[source]ÔÉÅ
reconstruct(ds, groups)[source]ÔÉÅ
rforecast(ds, groups, length=1, base='reconstructed', only_new=True, reverse=False, drop=False, drop_attributes=False, cache=True, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ
ssa(x, L=None, neig=None, mask=None, wmask=None, kind='1d-ssa', circular=None, column_projector='none', row_projector='none', svd_method='auto')[source]ÔÉÅ
Parameters:

  • x (Union[class:pd.DataFrame, class:pd.Series]) ‚Äì object to be decomposed.

  • L (int, optional) ‚Äì window length. Fixed to half of the series length by default. Should be vector of length 2 for 2d SSA

  • neig (int, optional) ‚Äì number of desired eigentriples. If None, then sane default value will be used.

  • mask ‚Äì for shaped 2d SSA case only. Logical matrix with same dimension as x. Specifies form of decomposed array. If None, then all non-NA elements will be used

  • wmask ‚Äì for shaped 2d SSA case only. Logical matrix which specifies window form.

  • kind (str, optional) ‚Äì SSA method. This includes ordinary 1d SSA, 2d SSA, Toeplitz variant of 1d SSA, multichannel variant of SSA and complex SSA. Defaults to 1d SSA.

  • circular ‚Äì logical vector of one or two elements, describes series topology for 1d SSA and Toeplitz SSA or field topology for 2d SSA. ‚ÄòTRUE‚Äô means series circularity for 1d case or circularity by a corresponding coordinate for 2d case. See Shlemov and Golyandina (2014) for more information.

  • row_projector (int, optional) ‚Äì column and row signal subspaces projectors for SSA with projection.

  • svd_method ‚Äì singular value decomposition method.

Returns:

SSA Object. The precise layout of the object is mostly meant opaque and subject to change in different version of the package.

Return type:

class:SSA
